result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges by 06/09/16, or be docketed as a civil judgment.
Court ordered all non-mandatory costs waived due to defendant's financial instability.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Straight time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacey Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 (three) days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges by June 9, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered all non-mandatory costs waived due to defendant's financial instability.


Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Stacey Boyd in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Stacey Boyd in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ORIGINAL COURT FILE IS UNAVAILABLE - COURT RECORD ENTRY IS MADE IN A DUPLICATE FILE. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

ORIGINAL COURT FILE IS UNAVAILABLE - COURT RECORD ENTRY IS MADE IN A DUPLICATE FILE. Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Stacey Boyd not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a plea/sentencing hearing. No DA file in court.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with: ANY PICK N' SAVE.

Defendant Stacey Boyd in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Stacey Boyd in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT.

Defendant Stacey Boyd in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Stacey Boyd in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
